intro: Plagiobothrys myosotoides var. patagonicus, commonly known as the Patagonian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has hairy, narrow leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This variety is closely related to other species in the Plagiobothrys genus, which are known for their delicate floral structures and ecological significance in their native regions.
